title: 110_hr3444
content: The Act may be cited as the "Kansas Flood Recovery and Economic Opportunity Act of 2007" and includes an increased federal share for disaster assistance. The "Kansas Flood Recovery and Economic Opportunity Act of 2007" increases the Federal share of assistance for severe storms and flooding in Kansas from June 26, 2007, to July 25, 2007, to 100 percent of eligible costs under specific sections of the Stafford Disaster Relief Act. This applies to disaster assistance requested before the Act's enactment date. The Federal share provided by subsection (a) is limited to assistance for projects with a submitted "request for public assistance form." Temporary tax relief is provided for flooded areas in Kansas. Provisions of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 apply to areas affected by a major disaster declared by the President under the Stafford Disaster Relief Act. This includes suspending limitations on personal casualty losses and extending the replacement period for nonrecognition of certain provisions. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 applies to areas affected by a major disaster declared by the President under the Stafford Disaster Relief Act. This includes extending the replacement period for nonrecognition of gain due to severe storms and flooding in Kansas in 2007. Additionally, there is an employee retention credit for employers affected by the storms and floods on June 26, 2007.
